core

Class Drive

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.Drive

  • public class Drive
extends java.lang.Object
    Uses joystick to set the talons, or provides commands for the autonomous code to turn and move.
    Author:
    Programming

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Drive(MyJoystick newJoy) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void moveBack(double speed, boolean ramp)
      Moves the robot backward.
      void moveForward(double speed, boolean ramp)
      Moves the robot forward.
      void run()
      When this is run, it uses joystick input to maneuver the robot.
      void setMtLeftOne(double speed, boolean ramp)
      Sets the first motor on the left to the speed
      void setMtLeftThree(double speed, boolean ramp)
      Sets the third motor on the left to the speed
      void setMtLeftTwo(double speed, boolean ramp)
      Sets the second motor on the left to the speed
      void setMtRightOne(double speed, boolean ramp)
      Sets the first motor on the right to the speed
      void setMtRightThree(double speed, boolean ramp)
      Sets the third motor on the right to the speed
      void setMtRightTwo(double speed, boolean ramp)
      Sets the second motor on the right to the speed
      void setSpeed(double leftSpeed, double rightSpeed, boolean ramp)
      This function sets the left, and right speeds of the motors and ramps to the speed is ramp = true
      void stop()
      Stops the drive, no ramping
      void turnLeft(double speed, boolean ramp)
      Turns the robot to the left.
      void turnRight(double speed, boolean ramp)
      Turns the robot to the right.

      • run

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(double leftSpeed,
                     double rightSpeed,
                     boolean ramp)
        This function sets the left, and right speeds of the motors and ramps to the speed is ramp = true
        Parameters:
        leftSpeed - is the speed of the motors on the left side
        rightSpeed - is the speed of the motors on the right side
        ramp - is whether is should ramp or not

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the drive, no ramping

        ramp - is whether to ramp to the speed
